Sentencas: Electrochemical methods such as voltammetry and electrochemical impedance spectroscopy are effective for quantifying solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) operational performance, but not for identifying and monitoring the chemical processes that occur on the electrodes' surface, which are thought to be strictly related to the SOFCs' efficiency.
Titulo: Real-time thermal imaging of solid oxide fuel cell cathode activity in working condition

Sentencas: Because of their high operating temperature, mechanical failure or cathode delamination is a common shortcoming of SOFCs that severely affects their reliability.
Titulo: Real-time thermal imaging of solid oxide fuel cell cathode activity in working condition

Sentencas: Infrared thermography may provide a powerful tool for probing in situ SOFC electrode processes and the materials' structural integrity, but, due to the typical design of pellet-type cells, a complete optical access to the electrode surface is usually prevented.
Titulo: Real-time thermal imaging of solid oxide fuel cell cathode activity in working condition

Sentencas: In this paper, a specially designed SOFC is introduced, which allows temperature distribution to be measured over all the cathode area while still preserving the electrochemical performance of the device.
Titulo: Real-time thermal imaging of solid oxide fuel cell cathode activity in working condition

Sentencas: Infrared images recorded under different working conditions are then processed by means of a dedicated image processing algorithm for quantitative data analysis.
Titulo: Real-time thermal imaging of solid oxide fuel cell cathode activity in working condition

Sentencas: Results reported in the paper highlight the effectiveness of infrared thermal imaging in detecting the onset of cell failure during normal operation and in monitoring cathode activity when the cell is fed with different types of fuels.
Titulo: Real-time thermal imaging of solid oxide fuel cell cathode activity in working condition
